chapter.title: Introduction
chapter.paragraph: When people are working on free software, they would like to be paid for it. Of course this conflicts with the fact, that the software itself is free of charge itself. One can charge money for additional services like file hosting, server hosting, community services, support and so on. But it does not change the fact, that software itself can be used in principle by anyone.

A classic approach to tackle the problem is to raise money through
funding platforms. https://opencollective.com/

chapter.title: Advertisment in Program
chapter.paragraph:
One idea was
to display advertisement in the terminal during the installation process of the open source program.

chapter.title: FOSS Core with Proprietary Extension
chapter.paragraph:
One other solution is to have the core application being FOSS
while selling non-FOSS extensions . In such a constellation such extensions can be made FOSS when the functionality of such extensions becomes common enough that it is not critical for funding anymore. See timefold as an example.
